intro: Lasiospermum rigidum, commonly known as the rigid thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
